description:
When Mafuyu Oribe and her adopted sister Tomo rescue a strange wounded man, they have no idea what they're getting involved with or what the consequences will be. Alexander Nikolaevith Hell is an Iron Qwaser, one of many opposing factions of super-warriors who can each draw upon the power of an element and wield it as an almost unstoppable array of weapons. And unfortunately for Mafuyu, Alexander's faction is there to gather the mystical relics known collectively as the High Circuit, which puts her friends, family and school at ground zero in a battle for the fate of all mankind! But there's an even more disturbing twist, as Qwasers require a special liquid diet to manifest their powers, one provided by the women who serve as a Qwaser's partner. And THAT means that the nursing Mafuyu's already given Alexander isn't the only kind of nursing he needs!

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Large Breasts
tags.description: Features a character with larger-than-average breasts.

tags.name: Lactation
tags.description: Features breast milk play and production.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Masochism
tags.description: Prominently features characters who get sexual pleasure from being hurt or controlled by others.

tags.name: Psychosexual
tags.description: Work that involves the psychological aspects of sexual impulses.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Femdom
tags.description: Female Dominance. Features sexual acts with a woman in a dominant position.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Sadism
tags.description: Prominently features characters deriving pleasure, especially sexual gratification, from inflicting pain, suffering, or humiliation on others.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Nun
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a nun.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

node.description:
__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")

[Blog](http://ameblo.jp/hirano--aya/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hysteric_barbie) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/a_ya.hirano/) | [Website](http://ayahirano.jp/)

Aya Hirano is a Japanese actress, voice actress, and singer. Beginning in the entertainment industry as a child actor performing in television commercials, she played her first voice acting role in 2001 in the anime television series [Angel Tales](https://anilist.co/anime/682/). She released her first single "Breakthrough" in 2006, and her first album Riot Girl in 2008. She was formerly contracted to Space Craft Produce, a branch of the Space Craft Group, before moving to the talent agency Grick in August 2011. Her label was Lantis until 2011, when she moved to Universal Sigma. On September 1st, 2022, she announced that she was becoming a freelancer. 

Hirano is widely known for her roles as [Haruhi Suzumiya](https://anilist.co/character/251/) in the [Haruhi Suzumiya](https://anilist.co/anime/849/) franchise, [Konata Izumi](https://anilist.co/character/2169/) in [Lucky Star](https://anilist.co/anime/1887/), [Misa Amane](https://anilist.co/character/835/) in [Death Note](https://anilist.co/anime/1535/) and [Lucy Heartfilia](https://anilist.co/character/5186/) in [Fairy Tail](https://anilist.co/anime/6702/).

In 2011, she temporarily ceased accepting new roles to recover from a pituitary gland tumor that had been affecting her health. She resumed voice acting activities later that year. In 2016, after appearing at a stage play in Tokyo, she went to New York to study abroad for four months.

__Awards:__
- Best Voice Actor at the Tokyo Anime Awards in 2007 for her role as Haruhi Suzumiya.
- Best Rookie Actress at the 1st Seiyuu Awards in 2007 for her role as Haruhi Suzumiya.
- Best Lead Actress at the 2nd Seiyuu Awards in 2008 for her roles as Konata Izumi, Misa Amane and [Layla Serizawa](https://anilist.co/character/2089/)

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Official Website](https://www.minorichihara.com/) | [Profile (HoriPro)](http://www.horipro-international.com/artist/chihara) | [Website (Lantis)](https://www.lantis.jp/artist/chiharaminori/) | [Blog](https://lineblog.me/minori_parade/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/minori_contact) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/minori_chihara/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minori_Chihara) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/茅原実里)

Minori Chihara is a Japanese voice actress and singer.

On April 2, 2021, she announced via her blog that she was taking an indefinite hiatus on her singing activities at the end of the year, but continuing to voice act.

__Height:__ 169 cm

[Website](http://www.toyosakiaki.com/) | [Profile](http://musicrayn.com/toyosaki_aki) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/toyosakiaki-blog/) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/23897.html) | [Twitter](https://x.com/a_toyosaki_yoda) | [Bilibili](https://space.bilibili.com/48207005) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aki_Toyosaki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%B1%8A%E5%B4%8E%E6%84%9B%E7%94%9F)

A voice actress and singer affiliated with Music Ray'n. One of the members of [Sphere](https://anilist.co/staff/103636).

**Non-Anime Roles:**
• Navia - Genshin Impact (VG)
• Crown - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1521695330)

Currently working as a freelancer, having previously worked for [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/) and [D.A.S.T.](https://anilist.co/studio/6255/)

Yuuki graduated from Saitama Prefectural Toda Shoyo High School and has been active in the school's "Manga and Anime Research Interest Club.” He found business in the National Health Insurance but couldn't give up on being an animator, so he left and became an animator instead. Has collaborated with director [Kazuki Akane](https://anilist.co/staff/102416/) many times, including on his most famous work, [The Vision of Escaflowne](https://anilist.co/anime/182/).

He works on doujinshi under the circles The Man in the High Castle and Ubik, both references to the works of American science fiction author Philip K. Dick. The published doujinshi include key animation from his body of work and specially drawn manga. On the other hand, since he worked on Ralphilia Saga by [Akara Arisato](https://anilist.co/staff/149449/), he has been involved in several works as a guest member of the doujin circle La Moon.

[Official Website](http://www.topazios.net/) 

Yui Itsuki is a Japanese voice actress who works for Holy Peak. As a musician, she is currently the lead vocalist for the band Yousei Teikoku (under the persona of "Dictator for Life" 終身独裁官, the supreme leader of The Fairy Empire).
Originating from [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/) where he studied under [Atsuko Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/102141/).

[Twitter (NSFW)](https://twitter.com/ozone_maru) | [Pixiv (NSFW)](https://www.pixiv.net/users/15639)

Publishes explicit doujinshi under the name "Marumiya."
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uezux) | [Website](http://uezu.soregashi.com/)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uezux) | [Website](http://uezu.soregashi.com/)

__Height:__ 157 cm 

[Agency Profile](https://inari-inc.com/talent/yoko-hikasa/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hikasayoko-official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hikasayoko_official/) | [Threads](https://www.threads.net/@hikasayoko_official) | [(Old) Twitter](https://twitter.com/hikasayokoSP)

Co-hosted the popular weekly radio show Odoroki Sentai Momonoki Five (おどろき戦隊モモノキファイブ) with fellow seiyuu [Eriko Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/103983) from 2009 to 2017.
She got married to a person from outside the industry in 2015.
On September 5, 2024, she announced that she was starting her own voice talent agency, [i.nari](https://inari-inc.com/), which would also be representing her going forward.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Neve - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Red Hood - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Celia - Tevi (VG)
- Emilie - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Judith Lanster - The Legend of Heroes Series (VG)
- Brigitta Lycaon - Metaphor: ReFantazio (VG)
- Vita - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
- Saeki Kazuko - YanOta: The Delinquent and the Otaku (Drama CD)
- Evelyn Chevalier - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)

[Official Website](http://dasfeenreich.com/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6CDPvGtPJ6Iz7uftJYQpxO?autoplay=true) 

Yousei Teikoku is a four-member Japanese musical unit, formed in 1997 and part of TEAM FAIRITHM. Their music contains elements of electro, EBM, darkwave, neoclassical, ethereal and ambient mixed with gothic rock/metal. They have released several independent albums and four major release albums with their current publisher Lantis: Gothic Lolita Propaganda, metanoia, Gothic Lolita Doctrine and Gothic Lolita Agitator.  The members are: 

Itsuki Yui - vocals, chorus, and lyric writing. | Tachibana Takaha - keyboards, guitar, composition, arrangement and lyric writing. Has worked with Kukui in the past. | Nanami - bass guitar. | Relu - drums. 

Prior to the release of Baptize, Yui and Tachibana were the group's only members. Nanami and Relu have since been added. Yousei Teikoku literally means Fairy Empire. Through music, Yousei Teikoku is attempting to revive the Fairy Empire that exists between the human world and the spiritual realm known as Spiritual. The purpose of their music is "to make humans remember the pure heart inside them that believes in fairies, forgotten before we knew it". "Gothic" and "empire" are key words in their musical ideas.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

Originating from Eagle Nest. Currently freelance.

Tanaka first drew attention for the wild and imaginative fight sequences in Precure [Max Heart](https://anilist.co/anime/1929/) and [Splash Star](https://anilist.co/anime/1534/). Following this he expanded his scope and took up work on productions all around the industry, showing that fights aren't everything he can do. His variety on running sequences, often showing an effiminate touch, as well as the particular attention to hair, down to all little strains and often involving a hairdo having a life of its own, are some of Tanaka's most outstanding feats.

__Non-anime credits:__
~!
- Chief Animator, Animation Character Design, Storyboard, Director, Animation Director, Key Animation for "BlazBlue: Calamity Trigger (OP)" (video game, 2008)
- Key Animation for "Disgaea D2: A Brighter Darkness (OP)" (video game, 2013)
- Key Animation for "livetune adding Fukase (from SEKAI NO OWARI) 「Take Your Way」" (music video, 2013)
- Key Animation for "Rurouni Kenshin: Meiji Kenkaku Romantan Saisen (OP)" (video game, 2011)
- Key Animation for "Valkyria Chronicles III" (video game, 2011)!~

[Blog](http://ameblo.jp/faylan/)

Before she was signed with Lantis, she had released one single under Hobirecords.  
Non-anime singles:  "Gekka no Rasen" - PC game Touka Gettan ED "Never Slash!!" - PC game "Gakuto!" theme song "Reconquista" - PC game "Reconquista" theme song "conspire" - PC game Valkyrie Complex insert song "Soukyuu no Hikari" - BlazBlue Continuum Shift Extend opening song (PS3/360)

__Machida Touko__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakuribo)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/siglic)

**Shigeru Morita** is a Japanese script/screenwriter.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tsuchiyawn)

__Hiroyuki Yoshino__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

Since the beginning of his career he has been working with Studio Sunrise, he has scripted various of its anime including [Mai-HIME](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/), [Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Hangyaku-no-Lelouch) and [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/99/MaiOtome/).

Upon graduating from the Waseda University's School of Literature, he went on to become a teacher of world history at a high school. After this, Hiroyuki joined the staff of Tokuma Shoten's Animage magazine as a writer. It was in this magazine that the Sunrise producer Furusato Naotake offered him a position in the studio as a screenwriter.

Since joining Studio Sunrise, the first series in which he was the head-writer, as well as the series composer, was the series Mai-HIME, followed-up by [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/) and [Mai-Otome Zwei](https://anilist.co/anime/1609/MaiOtome-Zwei/). He also went on to supervise, as an extension to this work. Hiroyuki has also authored the manga adaption of [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/manga/31069/MaiOtome/) (alongside Tatsuhito Higuchi), and went on to write numerous other manga series.

__[Website](https://akihata.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akihata_jp) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/akihata.jp/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/AKIHATAjp)__

__Aki Hata__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of the music production team [Q-MHz](https://anilist.co/staff/156926/QMHz).
Originating from Araki Production.
